intro: Chamaesyce orbifolia, commonly known as the orb-leaf sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are orbicular in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or pale yellow in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or dune environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
